intro: Barleria samhanensis, commonly known as the Korean barleria, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
